knowledge.question: What is the output of the above C code snippet? //This question is compiled on 32 bit DEV-C++
explanation: The sizeof operator determines the size of a data type (number of bytes). For the first sizeof(ptr1) it is determining the size of the pointer, which is 4 bytes. The second, sizeof(*ptr) dereferences the pointer so it determines the size of a char, which is 2 bytes
